what is vinegar so vinegar is basically
something that's made out of three
things it's an alcohol mixed with oxygen
and then bacteria specifically a type of
bacteria called acetobacter bacteria
which is the only bacteria out there
that can actually take something like
alcohol and it uses it as a source of
energy and creates acetic acid and water
giving you what we know today as vinegar
so you can pretty much have vinegar out
of two different things an alcohol made
from a fruit such as wine a fortified
wine like sherry or even a hard cider
apple cider or you can have it made out
of a grain alcohol like rice malt which
is something that's typically used in
beer or straight-up distilled vinegar
which is made from a high proof grain
alcohol so I have the two differences
set out in front of me here so starting
with what I would say is probably the
most typical thing that you would use in
your kitchen today and that is white
wine vinegar and red wine vinegar and a
lot of people make salad dressings with
these two vinegars and they are made
from the alcohol red or white wine now
they're mostly sold in the United States
in a generic form where they'll say red
wine vinegar or white wine vinegar but
in some specialty shops you can actually
find vinegars that are made from
specific types of wines so you might
find a champagne vinegar or you might
find a merlot red wine vinegar and what
that is is just a little bit more
specific it might have more nuanced
flavor to it and you should pick it up
if you can find it in the store now in
addition we have white balsamic which is
something new that you might find in
your supermarket and then there's the
classic balsamic that we all know now
classic balsamic vinegar is made from a
wine that uses Trebbia no grapes which
are Italian grapes and also red
lambrusco grapes and is typically aged
in oak barrels in a slow process that
really gives balsamic its signature
flavor in addition to balsamic there's
apples
vinegar which is another fruit vinegar
which is made from hard cider and you
can find apple cider vinegar in two
forms in your supermarket there's the
filtered version which is kind of
classic and typical and you can see I'm
going to pour it here it has a
crystal-clear appearance
there's no opacity to it it's clear and
then the unfiltered apple cider vinegar
which you can see is kind of cloudy and
milky and this has the particles left in
it from the process of combining the
bacteria with the alcohol hard cider and
oxygen and it is not filtered so it
doesn't give you that crystal clear
liquid now in addition to the vinegars
that I've been talking about before my
favorite vinegar that I love to have on
hand for so many different things is
sherry vinegar and sherry vinegar is
made from the fortified wine sherry and
it goes through that same process again
with the bacteria and the oxygen and it
is slowly aged in barrels there are two
different kinds of sherry vinegar out
there in the market there's kind of a
classic and then there's the reserva so
the classic sherry vinegar has to age in
barrels for at least six months where
the reserva is at least two years and
the version I have here with me is
thirty so that means that it's in oak
barrels for about thirty years so if you
can find a sherry vinegar I would
encourage you to pick it up and if you
have the opportunity to get a reserva
which has this richer more robust and
oxidized flavor which is really
fantastic it's really dynamic I would
encourage you to do so now you can find
these at specialty shops and also in a
lot of grocery stores that carry
specialty items so this is the reserva
it's very dark in color not as
transparent in light as kind of just the
traditional sherry vinegar so you can
see the difference in color here the
reserver is much darker in color and
it's more dynamic and has a really
fantastic flavor as compared to just the
classic only 6-month aged sherry vinegar
which I have here which is lighter in
color and OMA
you can kind of see through it all right
so moving on to the vinegars that are
made out of grain based alcohols and
those are kind of the typical vinegars
that you know and maybe you have in your
pantry distilled vinegar is made from a
pure grain alcohol and it has the
highest amount of acetic acid in it so
that's why it's a quite intense vinegar
and is used a lot for household cleaning
but also for pickling as well it doesn't
have much flavor and it's not very
dynamic so it's not really great in
salad dressings or in a lot of different
uses maybe other than pickling or maybe
a barbecue sauce but I would actually
tell you for a more nuanced barbecue
sauce to use apple cider vinegar now
moving on another vinegar that is
typically used when you're consuming
fish and chips and that is malt vinegar
and that is made out of a malted barley
fermented alcohol and it has a really
interesting kind of caramely nose to it
which I'm sure you all have had Multan
occur on your french fries before but
malt vinegar can be interesting if you
use it in a salad dressing if you use it
in sauces or barbecue sauces so I would
encourage you to try it beyond just the
classic fish and chips now in addition
to the malted barley malt vinegar
there's also rice vinegars now rice
vinegars are used in a lot of Asian
cuisines there's the classic rice
vinegar which is clear like I have here
and then there's probably something that
I'm not sure that you've seen before and
that is Chinese black vinegar and that's
made from a glutinous rice fermented
alcohol and it has a really intense
almost balsamic like flavor to it and is
used in a lot of really great Chinese
dishes if you can find this in your

pick it up if you're curious about it
and you don't see it in your grocery

two there's yuzu rice vinegar which has

States and this is actually it's
fermented from a rice based spirit but
what else is added to it is yuzu which
is a Japanese citrus fruit and really
the flavoring is added into the rice so
it's a flavored vinegar
now vinegars are made in three different
ways and with the whiff vinegars like
balsamic and sherry vinegar they're made
in a very traditional way which is in
the barrel method where the vinegar is
allowed to kind of be created over time
so that can take anywhere from about two
months so that means that there's
alcohol there's bacteria and there's
oxygen ever so slightly
there's a little bit of oxygen within
the barrel and the process of converting
the wine into vinegar takes a little bit
longer and what that does that time it
creates a lot of really fantastic flavor
and that's why a lot of people love a
sherry vinegar or a balsamic vinegar or
even if you can find some specialty wine
vinegars that are aged in barrels and
created over time they have more of a
nuanced flavor now in addition to that
method the barrel method there's the
trickling method in which an alcohol is
kind of trickled through bacteria and
oxygen is picked up and that will take
anywhere from 24 hours to 2 days to
create a vinegar and lastly the
submerged method is where alcohol and
bacteria are combined in big vats and a
lot of oxygen is pumped through these
vats and that will help to create
vinegar in a very short amount of time
about 24 hours but there isn't a lot of
developed flavor there so if you can
find the barrel aged or barrel created
vinegars those are really the most
flavorful vinegars you will be able to
find if you're really curious about
different types of vinegars I would
encourage you to kind of seek out some
information on them there's always a lot
of great information out there and each
producer of vinegar especially in the
specialty market has a story to tell now
a favorite way to kind of highlight
vinegar on its own is in something so
simple as a salad now if you have fresh
flavorful farmers market tomatoes and
some aged balsamic again this balsamic
you can find many different varieties of
balsamic vinegar there's always a
mandate of how long it is aged in in
barrels some that go for years and years
and you
and the kind of water evaporates out of
the vinegar and it becomes more
concentrated and flavorful and this is
an aged balsamic vinegar that's almost
syrupy in texture and just kind of
drizzled over summer tomatoes with basil
a little bit of salt and pepper is a
